20101222190056.000|20101222190059.000|TR0|Tell."  It's now part of U.S. history.
20101222190059.000|20101222190101.000|TR0|
20101222190101.000|20101222190103.000|TR0|The law that had prevented gays and 
20101222190103.000|20101222190106.000|TR0|lesbians from serving openly in the 
20101222190106.000|20101222190108.000|TR0|military for years, it led thousands of 
20101222190108.000|20101222190110.000|TR0|men and women to leave the military.  
20101222190110.000|20101222190113.000|TR0|Earlier today, President Obama fulfilled a 
20101222190113.000|20101222190115.000|TR0|campaign promise to repeal the ban.
20101222190115.000|20101222190118.000|TR0|
20101222190118.000|20101222190120.000|TR0|Mr. Obama offered praise for all of those 
20101222190120.000|20101222190122.000|TR0|who worked to bring us this day -- the 
20101222190122.000|20101222190125.000|TR0|Defense secretary, the Joint Chiefs, 
20101222190125.000|20101222190127.000|TR0|members of both parties, and gays and 
20101222190127.000|20101222190129.000|TR0|lesbians serving in the military.  He also 
20101222190129.000|20101222190132.000|TR0|emphasized that the repeal does not 
20101222190132.000|20101222190134.000|TR0|immediately put a stop to "Don't Ask, 
20101222190134.000|20101222190137.000|TR0|Don't Tell."  Mr. Obama must certify that 
20101222190137.000|20101222190139.000|TR0|the changes to the law do not derail the 
20101222190139.000|20101222190141.000|TR0|military's ability to fight.  There's also 
20101222190141.000|20101222190144.000|TR0|a degree of opposition within the military 
20101222190144.000|20101222190146.000|TR0|to the change, especially in the Marine 
20101222190146.000|20101222190148.000|TR0|Corps, but the president vowed the changes 
20101222190148.000|20101222190151.000|TR0|would be put into action as quickly as 
20101222190151.000|20101222190153.000|TR0|possible.
20101222190153.000|20101222190156.000|TR0|

20101222190158.000|20101222190200.000|TR0|president is expected to happen any time 
20101222190200.000|20101222190203.000|TR0|now, the Senate's approval of the new 
20101222190203.000|20101222190205.000|TR0|START treaty with Russia.  Yesterday, the 
20101222190205.000|20101222190207.000|TR0|Senate voted 67-28 to end debate on the 
20101222190207.000|20101222190210.000|TR0|treaty.  It was made possible by 11 
20101222190210.000|20101222190212.000|TR0|Republican senators joining all the 
20101222190212.000|20101222190214.000|TR0|Democrats in supporting the treaty.
20101222190214.000|20101222190217.000|TR0|
20101222190217.000|20101222190219.000|TR0|Critics of it, led by Republican Senator 
20101222190219.000|20101222190222.000|TR0|Jon Kyl, seen here, argued that the 
20101222190222.000|20101222190224.000|TR0|treaty's inspections are inadequate and 
20101222190224.000|20101222190226.000|TR0|that Russia would be in a stronger 
20101222190226.000|20101222190229.000|TR0|position to try and prevent deployment of 
20101222190229.000|20101222190231.000|TR0|a U.S. missile defense system in Europe.  
20101222190231.000|20101222190233.000|TR0|Here are the nuts and bottles of the 
20101222190233.000|20101222190236.000|TR0|treaty.
20101222190236.000|20101222190238.000|TR0|
20101222190238.000|20101222190241.000|TR0|Both sides agreed to resume inspections of 
20101222190241.000|20101222190243.000|TR0|nuclear arsenals. They agreed to reduce 
20101222190243.000|20101222190245.000|TR0|warheads to 1,550 and launchers to 700.
20101222190245.000|20101222190248.000|TR0|
20101222190248.000|20101222190250.000|TR0|By comparison, here are current levels.  
20101222190250.000|20101222190252.000|TR0|The U.S. has 1,950 warheads, 798 
20101222190252.000|20101222190255.000|TR0|launchers.  Russia has 2,540 warheads, but 
20101222190255.000|20101222190257.000|TR0|only 574 launchers.

20101222190742.000|20101222190744.000|TR0|why.  The water came -- normally in these

20101222194844.000|20101222194846.000|TR0|

20101222194849.000|20101222194851.000|TR0|Pine Manor looked around 15 years ago and 
20101222194851.000|20101222194853.000|TR0|said why does the world need another small 
20101222194853.000|20101222194856.000|TR0|liberal arts college in Chestnut Hill, 
20101222194856.000|20101222194858.000|TR0|Massachusetts, and our answer was because 
20101222194858.000|20101222194900.000|TR0|the job of education is not being 
20101222194900.000|20101222194903.000|TR0|completely accomplished.

20101222194908.000|20101222194910.000|TR0|potential in our population among 
20101222194910.000|20101222194912.000|TR0|especially low-income young people.  This 
20101222194912.000|20101222194915.000|TR0|country as a whole hasn't moved in 40 
20101222194915.000|20101222194917.000|TR0|years in terms of the percentage of the 
20101222194917.000|20101222194919.000|TR0|population that goes to college and 
20101222194919.000|20101222194922.000|TR0|graduates from college.  So, globally, we 
20101222194922.000|20101222194924.000|TR0|have slipped from first place to 13th 
20101222194924.000|20101222194927.000|TR0|place, that hurts us on every level.  
20101222194927.000|20101222194929.000|TR0|Certainly, hurts us on the human level.
